techmeme.title: Marques Brownlee says "I hear you" after criticism of his new freemium wallpaper app Panels, which asks for many permissions and costs $50/year for full access (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Sources: Mark Zuckerberg wants to get away from politics, pulling back from charitable causes that may seem partisan, tamping down employee activism, and more (New York Times)
Google Cloud debuts Gemini 1.5 Flash and 1.5 Pro with a 2M context window, twice as big as before, "grounding" for better Google search accuracy, and new agents (Larry Dignan/Constellation Research)
Sources describe Meta's efforts to de-emphasize political content across its family of apps, its reduction and reshuffling of election integrity staff, and more (New York Times)
In a controversial move, Israel's ISA clears AI startup Bridgewise to launch a chatbot that gives stock picking advice, slated to debut with a big Israeli bank (Saritha Rai/Bloomberg)
